title: Binomial Coefficient Formula
text: The formula to find the nth term is as follows: C(n, $$n-(r-1))$$ * $$a^{n \left(r-1\right)}$$ * $$b^{r-1}$$.
speech: The formula to find the nth term is as follows: C(n,  n minus, parentheses r minus 1,    *  a raised to the n, parentheses r minus 1,  power  * , b raised to the r minus 1 power .
pacedSpeech: The formula to find the nth term is as follows: C(n,   n minus,  r minus 1,
*   a raised to the n,  r minus 1,  power
*  , b raised to the r minus 1 power

title: Plugging into the Formula
text: $$r=7$$, $$n=11$$. Plugging in these values into the formula above gives: $$462a^5 b^6$$
speech: r is equal to 7 ,  n, is equal to 11 . Plugging in these values into the formula above gives: , 462 a to the fifth b to the sixth
